Detailed Description

Class SideGeometry manages the mapping between the AMR index space and the side-centered geometry index space. It is a subclass of hier::BoxGeometry and it computes intersections between side- centered box geometries for communication operations.

See header file for SideData<TYPE> class for a more detailed description of the data layout.

See also:
hier::BoxGeometry

pdat::SideOverlap

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::SideGeometry ( const hier::Box &  box,
const hier::IntVector &  ghosts,
const hier::IntVector &  directions 
)

Construct the side geometry object given an AMR index space box, ghost cell width and directions vector indicating which coordinate directions are allocated.

Precondition:
box.getDim() == ghosts.getDim()

ghosts.min() >= 0

directions.min() >= 0

SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::~SideGeometry (  )  [virtual]

The virtual destructor does nothing interesting.

Member Function Documentation

hier::Box SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::toSideBox ( const hier::Box &  box,
int  side_normal 
) [static]

Convert an AMR index box space box into an side geometry box. An side geometry box extends the given AMR index space box by one at upper end for the side normal coordinate direction.

Precondition:
(side_normal >= 0) && (side_normal < box.getDim().getValue())

void SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::transform ( hier::Box &  box,
int &  normal_direction,
const hier::Transformation &  transformation 
) [static]

Transform a side-centered box.

At input, the Box is assumed to represent an side-centered box with the given normal direction. The Box will be transformed according to the coordinate system transformation defined by the Transformation object. At output, normal_direction will represent the output box's new normal direction.

Parameters:
[in,out] box 
[in,out] normal_direction 
[in] transformation 

void SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::transform ( SideIndex &  index,
const hier::Transformation &  transformation 
) [static]

Transform a SideIndex.

This static method applies a coordinate system transformation to the given SideIndex.

const hier::IntVector& SAMRAI::pdat::SideGeometry::getDirectionVector (  )  const [inline]

Return constant reference to vector describing which coordinate directions managed by this side geometry object.

A vector entry of zero indicates that this object will not perform operations involving the corresponding coordinate direction. A non-zero value indicates otherwise.
